p:
Besides the BLI assay, also a hemagglutination inhibition (HAI) assay was performed using the H3-containg WU95 virus for a number of our compounds. Results are shown in Table 1 . Overall the results show the same trends but the K iâ€™s for the most potent compounds 14 and 15 were not as low but still in the low micromolar range. It should be noted that the conditions are different in both assays, and especially multivalency effects can vary due to the in vitro assay conditions.
47 Notably the receptor density on red blood cells is considerably higher than present in the BLI assay.
